mng: surname Di, generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)

exm.mng: Di Renjie (607-700), Tang dynasty politician, prime minister under Wu Zetian, subsequently hero of legends, master sleuth Judge Dee, aka Chinese Sherlock Holmes, in novel Three murder cases solved by Judge Dee 狄公案[Di2 gong1 an4] translated by Dutch sinologist R.H. van Gulik 高羅珮|高罗佩[Gao1 Luo2 pei4]
Dickens (name), Charles Dickens (1812-1870), great English novelist
non-Han tribes in the east and north of ancient China, barbarians
Oedipus, hero of tragedy by Athenian dramatist Sophocles

Dee Gong An or Judge Dee's cases, 18th century fantasy featuring Tang dynasty politician Di Renjie 狄仁傑|狄仁杰[Dí Rén jié] as master sleuth, translated by R.H. van Gulik as Three murder cases solved by Judge Dee (lit. the Di Renji case)
Aphrodite, Greek goddess of beauty and love, daughter of Zeus, latin Venus

exm.pyn: Chá ěr sī · Dí gēng sī
